messages.content: Sender: ```  ({ privateKey: senderKey, publicKey: senderAccount } = Local.testAccounts[5]);```
Hey @IaM [ZK] <DEV> . Have you found the cause of this? I am also facing this error.
You can see explanations in https://discord.com/channels/484437221055922177/1183684692113903647/1183769127236669530
Hi @DFST , just curious why are you passing the 'nonce' when creating the transaction ? It does not seem necessary, but I suppose you may have some good reason for this 🙂

This way, I can send many transactions to one block using the same deployer. Your contract should be stateless for it to work, and mine is stateless. Code example:
https://github.com/dfstio/minanft-lib/blob/master/tests/update.test.ts#L128

122 transactions in one block:
https://minascan.io/testworld/block/3NKCH5552TNFAGhCbprddsbSbLwc4YqimqLVjeepY9Hg2Kh9Darf/zk-txs

By "stateless" I think you mean SmartContract with no state variables, just methods. This contracts will never do a state change in the account. Is this right ? Or you are referring to something else ? If you think this is not the right place for this question, I can DM you if you prefer so.

You are right; stateless means the contract without state variables.  Still, the contract can have non-state variables. For example, I have a public key written to the contract state that is used to verify signatures. The value of this public key is not being changed by the usual transactions, so it can be considered quasi-constant:
https://github.com/dfstio/minanft-lib/blob/master/src/contract/names.ts#L71

I see. So you can have methods in that contract that use that public key but do not change state in any other way. I mean, the public key is set only once, and then you can dispatch many transactions on the same block using the other "stateless" methods. Very good ! Thanks
Yes, exactly)
Really good idea !

To put many transactions in the same block I use a set of running workers (dispatchers) each one running with its own deployer/sender account. And my "custom" sequencer coordinates the workers and manages the transactions queue. But this has the limitation that you can put at most one transaction per worker. On the other side it does not need stateless contracts. But your solution is quite awesome  really !
I mean workers and sequencer are running as a service (not in the browser)

I do the same, actually, now. Many workers  (AWS lambdas) can run in parallel to mint NFTs. I don't have a limitation on the number of workers; 128 workers in parallel were already tested, but I have a limitation on the number of funded private keys, so I put nonce into the code to be able to upgrade the system and use the same private key for minting several NFTs at the same time.

Mmm. This I don't get " I put nonce into the code to be able to upgrade the system and use the same private key for minting several NFTs at the same time".  But minting an NFT does not imply doing state changes ?

No state changes for the main contract. The NFT is being minted by creating a new token account and putting the state into this new account. The state of the main contract is not being changed:
https://github.com/dfstio/minanft-lib/blob/master/src/contract/names.ts#L132
Ok. Will look in more detail at your code.  Don't want to waste more of your time . Thanks a lot !

You are welcome! Those are docs for it:
https://docs.minanft.io/docs/nameservice
@Mario | Socialcap if you're already struggling with concurency and/or race conditions, you should give our docs a read as well 🙂

Hi @maht0rz - Not struggling, I already solved it just in our own custom way (one sequencer and many dispatchers running as as service) 🙂 Have it running and will releasing the Socialcap testnet probably on monday (with onchain batch claims voting).
what is a dispatcher in your model?

But after the Socialcap testnet release will give it a good look and do some tests. Currently in Protokit data availability seems to be in the works, so does not seem to be quite ready for production yet ?
all you have to do is use sequence state as a mempool if you'd like data availability
how did you solve data availability in your custom sequencer?
A small service that receives Tx data, prepares the Txn, proves it and dispatchs it to MINA.  A dispatcher for each diffrent transaction "type" .
who pays the fee?
We have a Postgres db (merkles and indexer data)
Socialcap accounts for now pay the fee
that really isnt data availability unless its replicated and attested to by e.g, a comittee

i recommend reading:
https://deploy-preview-1--aesthetic-beijinho-ea3a52.netlify.app/docs/architecture/protocol#state-transitions

and

https://deploy-preview-1--aesthetic-beijinho-ea3a52.netlify.app/docs/runtime/state

messages.content: Well, it works for the app now. It is centralized (I suppose just like in Protokit) but can be changed to  a decentralized solution in the future.
wdym? are you sponsoring every user's transaction fee on the L1?
KYC cost is definitely higher than the transaction cost))
Yes, just for now. After that we will make applicants to pay for their claims/credentials (the original version worked this way, was change to avois MINA Navigators pplicants pay for credentials).
and how did you solve the concurency issues steming from working with merkle trees? do you use sequence state?

https://github.com/Identicon-Dao/socialcap/blob/dev/api/src/dbs/offchain-merkle-map.ts

You hold the entire merkle map state in memory without persisting it?

messages.content: The UI sends a RPC call to the API, wich then posts a transaction to the Sequencer, using a named queue. So transactions are dispatched in sequence, but using multiple workers. So changes to the tree are done in sequence and persisted every time
i get that, we do it the other way around, the sequencer exposes an endpoint for a mempool, and workers come into play only when a block is produced and you need paralelism
This is the sequencer https://github.com/Identicon-Dao/socialcap-services/tree/main/src/sequencer

messages.content: The nullifiers are created in different moments, when assigning electors to a claim for example.
do you have a spec for the system from a high level perspective?
or at least a tl;dr; on the supported user flows? i want to rewrite it in protokit to show you what you're missing on
@Mario | Socialcap what happens in your system if someone frontruns your sequencer by providing an L1 transaction with a higher fee?
i mean under the assumption that your sequencer is proving L1 smart contract transactions before sending them to the L1 mempool?

This is the general voting process. Would love to have an idea of how to do this on Protokit 🙂 Some details are not included here and maybe some arrows are a little outdated but in general this is the process
Mmm. Probably will not be able to meet conditions (nullifiers are not public) and so will not be able to even send it. But is a good point that will need some thinking about
i mean users do generate the nullifiers themselves and may choose to publish them
or a malicious user may use their nullifier to frontrun the sequencer and re-cast their vote in a different manner
Nullifiers are created in the service (API) and not accesible to the user. We also have a NONCE private to the service when creating them
i also assume none of the voting is private, is it? as in private as in users creating the proofs of voting on their devices
doesnt the nullifier have to be generated by a wallet, and then verified in circuit? in my understanding nullifiers are bound to a message & public key

Semi private. The electors send a batch of votes signed with their wallet. In version 1 (Cohort1) vote were fully private. Had to change it for bath voting due to performance (sending signed data, instead of browser creater proof as done for Cohort1 version).
Not really, in general usage yes, but nullifiers have a broader scope as a way of preventing double spending (or double voting)
In the contrats there are examples of how are they being used

@maht0rz , thanks for your comments. Don't want to use more of your time 🙂 As I said, would love to have a better idea of how to use Protokit for Socialcap 🙏🏻 As soon as we release in testnet will give it a serious try !
i’ll try to use the diagram you’ve shared to implement a sample runtime that supports a basic user journey through socialcap
Thanks a lot !
do you want a livestream in the zkapp hangout while i do it? if you have 20mins of time
Mmm, not today. Have some personal issues today 😦  But if you can please record it, I will watch it on the weekend and send comments . And thanks again for your generous and valuable time  🙌🏻
im streaming in zkapp hangouts if anyone is interested 🙂
